TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed MessageBoxButton extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the buttons that are displayed on a message box. Used as an argument of the method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, the <xref:System.Windows.MessageBox.Show%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.MessageBox> type displays a message box that has an **OK** button. You can use overloads of the <xref:System.Windows.MessageBox.Show%2A> method that accept a <xref:System.Windows.MessageBoxButton> argument in order to specify different combinations of buttons, which include **OK**, **OK**/**Cancel**, **Yes**/**No**, and **Yes**/**No**/**Cancel**.
If you specify YesNo, you disable the **Close** button in the message box title bar. However, the **Close** button is enabled for all other options. When a user clicks the **Close** button or presses the **ESC** key, a message box returns a message box result value of <xref:System.Windows.MessageBoxResult>. However, if a message box displays only an **OK** button, clicking the **Close** button or pressing the **ESC** key causes a message box to return a message box result value of <xref:System.Windows.MessageBoxResult.Cancel>.
The value of the button that a user clicks is returned by <xref:System.Windows.MessageBox.Show%2A> and is one of the values of the <xref:System.Windows.MessageBoxResult> enumeration.
## Examples For more information, see [MessageBox Sample](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=160023).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.MessageBoxButton OK = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The message box displays an **OK** button.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.MessageBoxButton OKCancel = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The message box displays **OK** and **Cancel** buttons.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.MessageBoxButton YesNo = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The message box displays **Yes** and **No** buttons.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.MessageBoxButton YesNoCancel = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The message box displays **Yes**, **No**, and **Cancel** buttons.
